result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM123,15CM1217, 15CM701, 15CF736, 15CM638 called: 10:01am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Jack Bliss.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

(NOTE: 15CM1217 has already been DISMISSED)
State files AMENDED INFORMATION in 15CF736 as previously ordered by COURT on 12/18/16, including 15CM1217, 15CM701, 15CF736 and 15CM638 -- only remaining case is now 15CF736; COURT receives Amended Information.
COURT notes all counts from files 15CM123, 15CM701 and 15CM638 are now contained within information in 15CF736, and they should all be closed.

State moves to:
15CF736--
Cts. 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 15, 16, 17, 19 (Amended to reflect from case 15CF638), 21, 23, and 24>>All D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CF736--
Ct. 1 (Stalking-Prev Conviction Violent Crime/DA)>>NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 (Knowingly Violate D.A. Injunction/DA)>>GUILTY
Ct. 3 (Knowingly Violate D.A. Injunction/DA)>>GUILTY
Ct. 4 (Knowingly Violate D.A. Injunction/DA)>>GUILTY
Ct. 5 (Knowingly Violate D.A. Injunction/DA)>>GUILTY
Ct. 13 (Unlawful Phone Use/Threaten w/Obscenity)>>GUILTY
Ct. 14 (Misd BJ)>>GUILTY
Ct. 18 (DA/DA)>>GUILTY
Ct. 20 (Knowingly Violate D.A. Injunction/DA)>>GUILTY
Ct. 22 (Obstructing)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1>> 3.5 years TOTAL--1.5 years incarceration and 2 years ES; Concurrent to all sentences on misd. counts; Credit for 188 days of time already served.
CONDITIONS OF ES: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C with victim P.L. unless as approved by PO; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 7 domestic abuse surcharges; DNA surcharge and CC to be paid out of prison wages first, and any not paid to be condition of ES.
Defendant is NOT eligible for either CIP or ERP.


Cts. 2, 3, 4, 5, 14, 20, and 22>>9 months MCJ on each count, concurrent to each other and to all other counts, with credit on each count for 188 days of time already served; CC on each count; D.A. assessment on each count as charged as D.A.; DNA surcharge on each count.
Cts. 13 and 18>>90 days MCJ on each count, concurrent to each other and all other counts, with credit on each count for 90 days of time already served; CC; DNA surcharge and D.A. surcharge on DC.

COURT remands defendant to MCSD for delivery to WI State Prison system.

Adj: 10:32am

No contact with victim(s): P.L. 
Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort by Wausau PD to retrieve any personal belongings.
